column1: Vasomotor Rhinitis
column2: HaleyK, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Astelin has truly been a Godsend for me.  Like many others, I have suffered with VR since childhood...now over 15 years.  I would have sneezing "fits" for hours that would completely drain me & I would be in bed for the next day or two.  It was really debilitating at times...I know, just sneezing but it took everything out of me.  Finally my doctor diagnosed the condition as VR which explained why Antihistamines were ineffective...my body was not producing any histamines for medication to block!  Astelin has been 100% effective for me.  I sometimes worry about the day they take it off the market!  For about 6 years now, Astelin has kept my VR under control and I can function normally.  I still avoid triggers like scents, smoke, etc.  A note about the bad taste - my doctor taught me to look down at my toes when spraying so it does not drain straight into my throat.  It works like a charm :)

column1: Vasomotor Rhinitis
column2: Bwarren3, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After a bad case of fluid buildup, lost over 50 lbs but my sinuses went out of control. Have had sinus problems my entire life and always found something otc that worked until this time. Specialist Dr. recommended Astelin. Has worked since the 2nd spray. Now back to almost normal, when warm weather comes don't need it but cold weather works better every night without skipping nights. Great stuff. Other sprays never worked at all. No side effects.

column1: Other
column2: jungleinferno, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've had a long history of sinus infections, and had 3 in 4 months recently. Have tried Claritin, Sudafed, and other nasal sprays. Claritin and Sudafed stopped working after some time and other nasal sprays had an unacceptably long-lasting bitter taste. Astelin has changed everything. I take it only at night (makes me tired) and I sleep better, have not had a single sinus infection since starting it, and I can go days without blowing my nose. Astelin's going to put Kleenex out of business. Basically, this is a great product and I highly recommend that others with sinus issues give it a try.

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: molove, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i had used this before and stopped due to sneezing fits.  i ran out of my other nasal spray,so i went back to using this one.  again, terrible sneezing fits. now, by the 3rd use...i can barely bend my upper body or neck due to severe pain from the last sneezing fit.  i feel like i pulled a muscle or pinched a nerve in my chest/back/lower neck from the severe sneezing. came to research side effects/problems caused by this spray. i am in serious pain and will have to seek medical treatment if it persists tomorrow.  can't believe this was caused by a nasal spray.  very painful, dangerous and rather scary to think this could have happened.  it's been almost 12 hours and yet the pain is unbelievable...all from a sneeze induced by this spray.

column1: Other
column2: Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: A weekend urgent care doctor got me on this when I had a severe sinus affection that I had gotten fed up with. The doctor the week before wouldn't give me amoxicillan to help, so I went to the urgent care the weekend instead and this woman gave me a strong dose of amoxicillan and prescribed azelastine for   future head colds. She figured out (after years of suffering) that I do not handle colds very well due to my makeup in that region and as a result, I'm more susceptible to getting a sinus infection afterwards. That's why she gave me azelastine to boot. I cannot begin to describe what a difference it has made. For years doctors have told me to take basic saline solution, which has never worked. Right now I have a cold, and I am surviving. Trust me, that is saying a lot if you are referring to me.

column1: Vasomotor Rhinitis
column2: Jim Carr, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have suffered from vasomotor rhinitis for many years, with no relief.  Finally, I was prescribed Astelin for the condition.  The results were nothing short of miraclulous.  I am finally free of the coughing fits caused by the post-nasal drip brought on by this condition.  I coughed after eating, after exertion, smelling certain odors, upon going to bed, upon getting up in the morning, going outside from inside, coming inside from outside, heat, cold and humidity.  One day after starting Astelin, I was almost completely symptom free.  I highly recommend this treatment for anyone who suffers like I did.  I am finally free of this debilitating condition..Slight drowsiness is the only side effect I have experienced.

column1: Other
column2: TheRyanGuy, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am a Male, 28 years old fighting issues with Urticaria. (Burning, itchy, rash that comes and goes with the histamine levels in my body). When I can feel a flare up begining to happen, I would take a dose of this and within minutes everything starts to calm down before it has a chance to really escallate. The only real side effect was that it would cause stuffyness in my sinuses, which actually helped when my alergies were realy bad. It also made me drowsey at times, but that was no issue if I took the medicine before going to bed. Once a day is all I need so far.

column9: I have terrible, terrible allergies.  I have been on everything, but Astelin really is effective.  I'm fairly apprehensive to continue using for the rest of my life though, because I hate squirting something into my nose everyday.  Not sure how long I will stay on it, but truthfully this has catapulted my quality of life.   It is absolutely the best medicine for treating both indoor, and outdoor allergies.  My primary triggers are pollen, grass, cat hair, and dust.  This helps me deal with these relatively easy.  The after taste is very bad.  It almost always drips into the back of my throat, and taste terrible.  But it is worth the help it gives me.

column1: Vasomotor Rhinitis
column2: Shelby, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've spent most of the last 40 years feeling generally "ill" due to nasal allergy symptoms and chronic sinus infections. I've tried everything. My opinion of Astelin:Very effective, but not unless you commit yourself to using it EVERY DAY. There is the bad taste, which lingers awhile. Chase it with a tasty drink. It causes a tickling sensation in your nose that can trigger a sneezing fit within a couple of minutes after using it. Sometimes I worry that I'm sneezing most of it out before it can even absorb. This stuff ain't cheap, but if you add up the cost of all those OTC pills it is tolerable. The dry mouth side effect is not as bad as with other antihistamines I've taken. My nose still runs a little, but I haven't had a sinus infection since I started Astelin. That's saying a lot!

column2: popcorn0193, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Didn't work. Basically pointless because it made all the mucus in my nose want to drip out so i had to blow my nose. I had spotty nose bleed too. This is junk. Veramyst works alot better.

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: vw9729, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Caused me to have sneezing fits!  I thought this would be better than oral antihistamine and hopefully less drowsy - but immediately upon use, I began having a sneezing fit until all medicine was gone.  I kept taking it, thinking maybe I had to "get used to it", but it kept happening every time I took it.  Pharmacist nor doctor knew what caused this, so I had to call the pharmaceutical company themselves to finally get someone to tell me I was having an allergic reaction to it.

column1: Other
column2: gamboarn, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was bright and chipper today, expecting to get quite a few things done...After my doctors visit, I took the first dose when I got home, sat down to read some  allergy preventation literature and could not stay awake.  When I got up I was hungry although I had had lunch only 2 hours prior and eating only made my hungrier.  I notice these are expected side effects;  I just took off 12 pounds in the last 10 months and I am not about to gain them back!  I thought a nasal antihistamine would be milder but I guess not!  Not for me.  I will cancel this prespriction and seek some more natural treatments.

column9: for an antihistamine , i notice no drowsiness at all.  much better for me than the cortisteroids . only take when needed .thnx astelin

column1: Other
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had unusually high ragweed allergy this season.  My head has been stopped up, sore throat, fever, etc. and I also developed bronchitis.  I went to the doctor and she prescribed this med for my head congestion.  This med has not helped much with stuffiness and has done nothing to alleviate any allergy symptoms and has made my sore throat worse due to all the drainage.  But it's better than nothing.  Trying not to blow my nose or sniff after using this medication is difficult.

column1: Other
column2: none, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been using this medication (after trying everything thing else i  the market)and for the first rime in years I can breath normally. I have suffered from a "stuffy" nose causing severe lack of sleep evn inducing sleep apnea.  Do not know yet about long term use...so far I am in awe
